abstract.p: Media-Most, Russia's biggest independent media conglomerate, says major international investor might buy stake in company, which could help alleviate pressure on it just weeks after its offices were searched and its owner, Vladimir A Gusinsky, was temporarily detained by prosecutors on embezzlement charges; investor, who is not identified, has expressed interest in buying $211.6 million debt Media-Most owes to Gazprom, country's natural gas company; photo (S)

block.p: Russia's biggest independent media conglomerate, Media-Most, said a major international investor might buy a stake in the company, which could help alleviate pressure on it just weeks after its offices were searched and its owner, Vladimir A. Gusinsky, was temporarily detained by prosecutors on embezzlement charges. The investor, who was not identified, has expressed interest in buying a $211.6 million debt Media-Most owes to Gazprom, the country's natural gas company. The government is Gazprom's main shareholder. Such a transaction would reduce Gazprom's influence in Media-Most, owner of NTV, Russia's biggest television channel.
